;In October 2021, Zhang Ting and Lin Ruiyang attended the event . ;(TST Secret official Weibo screenshot/picture);

;

;On October 26, 2023, TST Secret’s headquarters in Shanghai came A group of people, they are agents from Malaysia and Singapore, "We are finally back," someone announced excitedly on social media.

;

;In fact, as early as August 24, "Big Brother" Lin Ruiyang recorded a video announcing that "our case has finally been concluded, and it is a very positive conclusion." He raised his voice and was a little excited. , "After the case is closed, I believe more people will think that they are such a good company." He is sorry that everyone has been wronged in the past two years.

;

;Until October 26, the "Legal Weekend" sponsored by the "Legal Daily", the organ of the Political and Legal Affairs Commission of the CPC Central Committee, reported that the Shijiazhuang Yuhua District Court had made a civil ruling and announced the unfreezing of 96 properties under their names and 600 million yuan in cash, this news became widely known, and then the video that Lin Ruiyang posted on Xiaohongshu two months ago became a hot search.

;

;According to the civil ruling obtained by Southern Weekend reporters, these 96 properties are located at No. 28 Jiangyao Road, Pudong New District, Shanghai, the secret headquarters of Jiting. According to public information from the Shanghai Housing Administration, they spent 1.76 billion yuan to purchase it in 2020, which was the fourth anniversary of TST's establishment.

;

;Lin Ruiyang was a Taiwanese artist, and later co-founded the micro-business beauty brand TST Ting Mi with his wife Zhang Ting. This brand has been questioned by suspected pyramid schemes in the past. Until April 2021, Shijiazhuang Yuhua The District Market Supervision and Administration Bureau applied to the court to freeze the huge property of a secretly affiliated company of the TST Tribunal on the grounds of suspected pyramid schemes. Only then did the outside world confirm that it was under investigation for suspected pyramid schemes.

;

;Right now, from the perspective of the secret side of the TST court, the outcome of the case has vindicated it. So, is it suspected of being a pyramid scheme? Why did the court unfreeze their property? Multiple documents obtained by Southern Weekend reporters provide the answer.

;

;;There is indeed a pyramid scheme;

;

;Is there a pyramid scheme in TST Court Secret? The answer is yes.

;

;An administrative penalty decision from the Baokang County Market Supervision and Administration Bureau of Hubei Province gave a clear answer: "The Baokang County Municipal Supervision Bureau believes that... the bonuses implemented by the parties for red card members The system requires the person being developed to develop other personnel to join, form an upline and downline relationship, and calculate and pay upline remuneration based on the sales performance of the downline, which belongs to the following behaviors in Article 7, Item (3) of the "Prohibition of Pyramid Selling Regulations", and is MLM behavior'".

;

;The person involved here is Shanghai Dalwei Trading Co., Ltd., the owner of the TST secret brand, and its legal representative is Lin Jirong. This is the real name of "eldest brother" Lin Ruiyang.

;

;The signing date of this administrative penalty letter is September 3, 2021. That is, as early as two years ago, TST Court Secret had been identified as a pyramid scheme and was punished.

;

;According to relevant national laws and regulations, pyramid schemes are divided into two situations, one is operational pyramid schemes and the other is fraudulent pyramid schemes.

;

;Operational pyramid schemes are subject to administrative penalties by the market supervision department in accordance with the "Regulations on Prohibition of MLM." It is only an illegal act. If there is no penalty of revoking the business license, you can continue to operate after accepting the administrative penalties and making rectifications and compliance.

;

;Fraudulent pyramid schemes are a serious crime, which falls under the criminal law of organizing and leading pyramid schemes and must be prosecuted by the procuratorate. The main difference between the two is whether there are actual business activities.

;

;This administrative penalty letter shows that the TST Tribunal secretly belongs to a commercial pyramid scheme. The pyramid schemes identified occurred in Shanghai Dalwei Trading Co., Ltd. from January 1, 2018 to July 2021, and the illegal gains were confiscated. And impose fines and require "correction within a time limit."

;

;In other words, you can continue to operate after making changes.

;

;In February 2022, the TST Tribunal secretly submitted an "Application for Guidance and Evaluation on the Rectification of the Product Sales System of Shanghai Dalwei Trading Co., Ltd." to the Baokang County Market Supervision and Administration Bureau. It listed its rectification measures in detail and believed that "the rectified product sales system is completely in line with normal business practices. There is no bonus method based on team salary, and it should not fall within the prohibited situations stipulated in the "Prohibition of Pyramid Selling Regulations."

;

;Southern Weekend reporters compared the two bonus systems before and after the rectification, the April 2021 version and the February 2022 version, and found that the biggest difference is that there is no team salary.

;

;The bonuses are divided into three parts: one is the sales discount bonus, the other is the batch difference bonus, and the third is the self-media education promotion bonus.

;

;The first is the name of the form. It used to be called "Ting Secret Dealer Bonus System-Red Card", but was later changed to "Ting Live Member Discount Table".

;

;The sales discount bonus is mapped to the new table and becomes a "discount". The difference is not big. This part is a commission for personal performance.

;

;The biggest change is the discount difference, which is the past "lot-to-retail bonus". This part is the commission for the team's performance. For example, the team sold a total of 10,000 yuan, of which 2,000 yuan was sold by the team leader himself. This part is commissioned based on personal performance. The remaining 8,000 yuan must be distributed with subordinates according to a certain proportion. This part is the team salary.

;

;The new rule after the rectification is that "the difference between the sales discounts corresponding to members and their direct members will be accumulated in the form of points or vouchers on the platform or system. The company will ultimately formulate redemption rules and redeem products within a certain period of time. Or deduct the purchase amount (ranging from 2% to 24%)."

;

;The "self-media education promotion bonus" that used to be extracted in proportion to the team's performance has now become a "promotion service fee." The promotion service fee has added conditions for receiving it, requiring that "the member's own live broadcast product performance is greater than 0 ".

;

;Previously, the proportion of promotion service fees calculated based on team performance was between 4% and 5%, but now it is unified at 3%.

;

;After rectification, Tingmi believes that “Tingmi’s sales performance commissions are only generated for directly related superior members, and they are all one-time rewards and are not passed on.”

;

;This rectification report also received a reply from the local regulatory authorities, stating that "our bureau will organize relevant personnel to conduct research in a timely manner." After that, TST Court Secrets has been operating normally.

;

;;One thing cannot be punished twice;

;

;It is precisely because Baokang County, Hubei Province has secretly conducted an investigation into the TST Court on May 25, 2021. This made the Market Supervision Bureau of Yuhua District, Baoding City, Hebei Province, which only opened the case for investigation on June 5, 2021, passive.

;

;The "Administrative Punishment Law of the People's Republic of China" has clear provisions, firstly, "prior jurisdiction", and secondly, "no penalty whatsoever". At the same time, the "State Administration for Industry and Commerce on Further Improving the Investigation and Punishment of Online MLMs The Notice also clarifies the jurisdiction of online pyramid schemes cases, and the competent authority shall apply the principle of full jurisdiction over the case.

;

;From this point of view, who has jurisdiction is the first issue that the two market regulatory authorities must resolve. Judging from subsequent developments, Baokang County, Hubei Province did not give up its jurisdiction and imposed penalties four months after the case was filed. The secret rectification of the TST Tribunal was also completed in February 2022.

;

;What really attracted widespread attention to this case was that on December 23, 2021, the Shijiazhuang Yuhua District Market Supervision Bureau announced in a reply to an inquiry letter that “because of its use of financial institutions to transfer or conceal the relevant To transfer the funds, our bureau has applied to the People’s Court to take preservation measures in accordance with the law.”

;

;In the end, this application was supported by the Yuhua District Court, which froze 96 properties and 600 million yuan in cash secretly owned by the TST Court.

;

;This court ruling freezing property has been questioned by the industry. Yang Fan, the attorney representing the case, said on social media, "How can the Yuhua District Market Supervision Bureau's application for court preservation be a civil ruling? The Yuhua District Market Supervision Bureau has not made any administrative decision in the past year. How can it be in the administrative agency? Are you going to apply for court preservation while the case is being investigated?"

;

;He Bing, another attorney in the case and professor of administrative law, also publicly questioned on social media, "Is this a civil pre-litigation preservation or a litigation preservation? The first preservation period was only 30 days, and litigation preservation was even more impossible. No one sued at that time or now, and it is impossible for the Market Supervision Bureau to be the plaintiff."

;

;Shijiazhuang Yuhua District Market Supervision Bureau stated in an interview with Upstream News that it had set up a task force and more than 400 law enforcement officers participated in the investigation. "Currently, it appears to be a commercial pyramid scheme. Whether it has the characteristics of a fraudulent pyramid scheme is still under investigation."

;

;Until July 26, 2023, the People’s Court of Yuhua District, Shijiazhuang, Hebei Province issued a civil ruling: “County and municipal-level industrial and commercial and market supervision departments should investigate and handle online pyramid schemes cases before filing or filing a case. At the same time, it was reported to the provincial industrial and commercial and market supervision departments step by step. Now that the report has been revoked, the conditions for this court to continue to implement preservation measures on the suspected online pyramid schemes assets in this case are no longer met."

;

;An insider involved in this case interpreted this paragraph of text to Southern Weekend reporter. He said, "The word "revoke" is used here instead of withdrawn, which means that the filing may have been revoked by the superior department rather than withdrawn. Yuhua District Municipal Supervision Bureau proactively withdrew the report. After withdrawing the filing, we cannot rule out the possibility that the case will be withdrawn in the future."

;

;In the opinion of this person familiar with the matter, in accordance with the principle of "nothing is dismissed" in the "Administrative Penalty Law of the People's Republic of China", if the Yuhua District Municipal Supervision Bureau believes that Baokang County has taken effect in the administrative decision If the illegal gains are incorrect, it involves the correction of administrative actions and must be submitted to the competent authority for cancellation in accordance with legal procedures.

;

;It is worth noting that the administrative penalty letter of Baokang County gives the secret and true business data of TST Court.

;

;The penalty letter shows: From January 1, 2018 to July 2021, TST secretly developed a total of about 7 million members, including about 6.41 million blue card members and about 650,000 red card members. .

;

;The main business income of the illegal red card is approximately 9.17 billion yuan, the main business cost is approximately 5.64 billion yuan, the main business taxes and surcharges are approximately 37.44 million yuan, and the actual related expenses incurred are approximately 3.458 billion yuan. billion, income tax expenses were 10.46 million yuan, and profits were approximately 19.27 million yuan. The profits of Shanghai Dalwei Trading Co., Ltd. should be considered illegal gains. The final penalty was the confiscation of illegal gains of 19.27 million yuan and a fine of 1.7 million yuan.

;

;The last time Shanghai Dalwei Trading Co., Ltd. was on the top 100 companies in Qingpu District, Shanghai was in 2019.

;

;In December 2021, due to the leakage of relevant replies from the Shijiazhuang Yuhua District Market Supervision Bureau, both Zhang Ting and Lin Ruiyang were banned from Weibo because of their involvement in pyramid schemes. As of May 26, 2022, Zhang Ting and Lin Ruiyang were banned from Weibo. The court's Weibo was updated again, stating that "Dalway Company encountered legal disputes and sought legal protection, which fully proves that Dalwe Company respects and believes in the legal environment of the motherland."

;

;Before becoming a painter, Honor Titus was the lead singer of a punk band; before becoming the lead singer of a punk band, he was a writer Also a poet.

;

;This path may be reversed and said again: because Ona Titus is a writer and poet, and his friend asked him: Hey, you write poetry anyway, why don’t you just write lyrics for us? ? As a result, he became a member of the punk band Cerebral Ballzy. Then, as the band became an instant hit, well-known artist Raymond Pettibon became a fan and designed the cover of one of their albums. Raymond asked Ona: Hey, I like your song, why don't you come to my studio and help? So Ona became Raymond's assistant. After familiarizing himself with all the operations of the art studio, he picked up the paintbrush himself and once again became an instant hit.

;

;;

;

;"Ona Titus: Viewing Distance" exhibition view, 2023, Longlati Jingwei Art Center, Shanghai;(Longlati Jingwei Art Center/Picture);

;

;Asia is Exciting

;

;No matter which order you listen to this story, Ona is undoubtedly an enviable lucky person. Almost as soon as he painted his first decent work, he was spotted by Taylor Gallery and brought to New York to exhibit. His paintings were hung side by side with the works of the famous Alex Katz. together. The response from the market is also exciting. Although he is just starting out and does not have any transaction records to back him up, more than 20 important collectors have expressed their intention to buy this painting. He also saw similarities in his paintings and Katz's paintings: bright colors, simple outlines, flat brushstrokes. "Seeing them hang me and Katz together, I realized that people are Understand my creation."

;

;It is indeed an eye-catching work: a man and a woman are resting in a leisurely manner on the grass covered with petals. The woman has her back to the picture and cannot see clearly. On the face, the man is like a southern yuppie, wearing a suit and a Panama hat, lying on his back. The whole picture is filled with a kind of nostalgic leisure, which is reminiscent of Seurat's "Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte" and Manet's " Lunch on the Grass.

;

;;

;

;"Kimbella", 2021, oil on canvas, 121.9cmx152.4cm Private collection, image courtesy of the artist and Taylor Gallery

;

;I try to write as I go This person, while listening to his song, was frightened by the deafening noise and turned off his headphones three minutes later. I realized that the Ona who painted the painting and the Ona who was the lead singer of the band may be different aspects of the same person. The calmness, alienation, and even classicalness revealed in his paintings are nowhere to be found in his punk music.

;

;Ona's recent solo exhibition "Viewing Distance" at Longlati Jingwei Art Center in Shanghai is his first solo exhibition in China. Prior to this, he had just finished an exhibition at Gagosian, and Asia made him particularly excited. “I had a painting at auction two years ago, and it was finally sold for five times the estimate. The collector is from Asia. It makes me feel the acceptance of my works in the East, and I am also curious about how Chinese audiences will evaluate my paintings." His pictures can't help but be associated with the atmosphere of Impressionism, which may be due to the two-dimensional attribute - —In this matter, it was Japanese Ukiyo-e that profoundly influenced Impressionism, and Chinese ink painting that profoundly influenced Ukiyo-e—a hidden line of culture that makes it possible to see déjà vu in viewing, and also reminds this kind of viewing distance on.

;

;Two noble men

;

;It was Raymond Pattybone who introduced him to the door of painting. For Ona, the few people who worked in Raymond’s studio were The year was a time of "information explosion" in his life. Raymond is a comprehensive artist. He was born in the United States in 1957. He is compatible with many iconic American cultural elements and is especially good at integrating images and text. Literature, art history, philosophy, religion, politics, business, fashion, sports, and deviant youth subculture are all sources of inspiration for Raymond. This complexity greatly influenced Ona. Raymond never taught him how to draw, but often discussed literature with him. "Raymond had a library, almost a small library. He often pulled out classic novels and talked to me about the stories in them." William. · Blake, Proust, John Ruskin and Walt Whitman... Literary nature constitutes Raymond's visual rhetoric and also profoundly influenced Ona.

;

;;

;

;"AP's Joy", 2022, oil on canvas, 182.9cmx121.9cm Danjuma Collection, image courtesy of the artist and Taylor Gallery

;

;Also in Redmond The studio provided Ona with access to a large number of painting classics. He found that he was interested in the Nabi School of painting, including Pierre Bonnard. The style that emphasized outline and color and eliminated perspective naturally lowered the technical threshold and gave amateur painters a simple and straightforward stepping stone.

;

;Another of Ona's great friends in painting was Henry Tylor, a famous artist who also lived in Los Angeles. Taylor is an expert at depicting characters, lively and productive. "Some media previously described Henry Taylor as my mentor, but he was actually just a close friend of mine." Henry Taylor held an exhibition for Ona in his studio, which was Ona's first as an artist. appearance. At that time, the COVID-19 epidemic broke out in the United States. Hundreds of guests crowded into Henry's studio. The gallerist among the guests immediately decided to take Ona's works to New York. "It was really a sensation."

;

;;

;

;"Into the Blue", 2021, oil on canvas, 214cmx183.5cm Collection of David and Indre Roberts. Image Courtesy of the artist and Taylor Gallery

;

;Novel Painting

;

;Thanks to a writer’s eye, Ona is most interested in people. Every minute he spent on the streets of China, he was observing the crowds around him and learning to speak Chinese at every opportunity. He enjoys painting people, including people in motion, people feasting in fine clothes, and people living leisurely and alone. He fixes a certain moment of people in a specific situation, and that moment itself is narrative. When he wanders around art galleries, his eyes are always drawn to paintings about people, such as Hopper or Andy Warhol.

;

;Different from those artists who usually accumulate visual materials and are good at photography or sketching, Ona's pictures are novel-like. He likes to paint fictitious images in his mind rather than copying real moments in life. His inspiration often comes from music or literature. "I did a painting of Miles Davis riding a horse, purely from my imagination."

;

;;

;

;Summer at Dodger Hall, 2021 , oil on canvas, 152.4cmx182.9cm Collection of Rony & Orly Grushka, image courtesy of the artist and Taylor Gallery

;

;Legendary musician Miles Davis is an outstanding conductor and performer in the history of American jazz music family, but later fell into drug addiction and bankruptcy, struggling with difficulties. "Miles grew up in the green countryside of St. Louis. He could ride horses as a child. Later he came to New York and entered the Juilliard School and experienced difficult times." Miles painted by Ona, Galloping horses in New York's Central Park was the image in his mind, and painting was to create images that might not exist but that the artist firmly believed existed.

;

;For Ona, painting was an unexpected success, bringing him wealth and a completely different life experience, but it delayed his ideal of becoming a writer. Music, painting, reading, writing... He jumps between different fields like a grid-jumper, with a playful agility.

;

;"What else do you want to draw next?"

;

;"I will write my novel within five years."

;

;"What kind of novel?"< /p>;

;"By no means an autobiography, I hope it is the kind of novel that Fitzgerald and Salinger would write. When the time comes, I will write it."

;

;My sister is a professional voice worker. She previously worked in a radio station for nearly thirty years as an announcer, Host and other jobs, now retired. It is difficult to define the concept of retirement for professional and technical personnel. They usually retire without rest: radio stations build training schools and ask her to teach broadcasting and hosting classes; relevant professional competitions ask her to be a judge and host programs; commercial organizations ask her to dub, Advertising... I used to be busy all day long, as fulfilling as working, and earning more than my pension.

;

;But now, I am basically retired, there are fewer and fewer jobs, and the remuneration for labor is getting lower and lower. In the past few years, the remuneration for each service was around 1,000-1,500 yuan, but later it dropped to 500, and then to 200-300 yuan each time. A few days ago, a shopping website asked: Do you want to accept product advertisements worth 20-30 yuan each? She felt exhausted both physically and mentally. This was really pointless. Forget it, let's not steal the business of young girls and boys. She had a pension after all.

;

;I watched the recent AI dubbing and was deeply shocked. I told her: It’s not you taking away the business of young girls and boys, nor is it someone taking away your business. But under the attack of AI, you will basically all be unemployed. Fortunately, I still have a pension. What should those young people who have studied broadcasting for more than ten years do?

;

;The current AI dubbing can achieve (on the algorithm side) intelligent translation and avoid nonsensical low-level errors; (on the audio side) simulate the timbre and voice of the object, and give it the personality characteristics of spoken language; (on the audio side) Video side) Correct the mouth shape.

;

;The result is: Swift and Trump actually spoke in very standard Chinese, while Cai Ming’s skit was performed in English. And the timbre is very similar to their own, and even the Mandarin spoken by Trump can be set to Mandarin with a slight southern accent. Not only can the sound be real, but in terms of video, their mouth shapes are highly consistent with the language they speak. Only by observing very carefully can you find traces of video modification in very few links. Based on the current speed of AI development, perhaps in a year, this weak trace of modification will be difficult to detect.

;

;In terms of intelligent translation, Call Annie, an intelligent interactive chat system based on ChatGPT launched by Animato, has been applied to Apple 12 and above platforms. As soon as it was launched, the stock price of Chegg, an American education platform, plummeted by 50%.

;

;Call Annie is not only a chat software, but also a fully AI education system. Currently, it can provide language services in English, French, German, Spanish and other major languages, and its teaching content covers professional knowledge in various disciplines such as mathematics, physics, chemistry, biology, programming, and finance. It can be expected that in the next 1-2 years, Call Annie is likely to develop to cover various human languages, including most minor languages ​​​​and even dialects, and the teaching content it can provide will increase exponentially.

;

;What’s even more amazing is: Call Annie does not require class appointments, is currently free, and can chat 24 hours a day. It does not feel tired, irritable, angry, or needs to get off work like human teachers do. It is more patient and has a good attitude. , He also didn’t criticize or reprimand. Even though I had a poor foundation and was mentally retarded, he still took the trouble to teach.

;

;Under such a powerful AI attack, it is estimated that many language teachers, basic knowledge teaching teachers, translators, and even university teaching assistants... as long as they are non-original research professors, will be in danger of being eliminated.

;

;Such a powerful AI is still evolving day and night. When I fall asleep, it is still learning, iterating, and improving... I don’t know whether I should continue to call it "it" or prepare to change it to "He, she".

;

;The attack of AI and the challenge to existing human work are not imminent, but the "wolf" has already arrived.

;

;IBM recently stated that it will suspend recruitment for positions that may be replaced by AI in the next few years, approximately 26,000 jobs. In the next five years, 30% of these positions will be replaced by AI and automation, which will involve the work of nearly 8,000 people. This is just IBM!

;

;February 2023, "Fortune" survey: 48% of 1,000 companies in the United States are gradually using ChatGPT to replace human employees, which will involve the work and livelihood of tens of thousands of white-collar workers.

;

;Goldman Sachs analyst Ben Snyder said: "In the next 10 years, artificial intelligence may increase productivity by 1.5% per year. This may increase the profits of S&P 500 companies by 30% in the next 10 years." % or more."

;

;Not only the United States, but also all walks of life in the country have also been impacted by AI. In April 2023, a large number of original animators at game companies were laid off, and some companies even laid off more than half of their original animators. The labor remuneration for a single painting by a freelancer has dropped from 1,500 yuan to about 200 yuan. We predicted in a previous article that arts and crafts designers would gradually lose their jobs, just over a year ago.

;

;Blue Focus, a well-known domestic advertising company, has completely stopped outsourcing copywriting and switched to AI writing. There is an e-commerce company founder who spent 3 months training GPT to write product copywriting and replaced 7 employees. Some Taobao merchants have used AI-generated digital models instead of real ones.

;

;Therefore, my sister’s loss of her former professional voice work was not an isolated case, but just a note in the common fate of millions of professional and technical people in the context of this era. The advancement of AI has developed from the field of engineering technology to the visual arts industry, and then expanded to language and performing arts.

;

;Even Lu Qi, the former president of Baidu, said: Now there is a time for swearing every week, because I am so shocked by the technology that I can’t help but swear. Because after the emergence of ChatGPT, AI technology has been developing rapidly in days. Under the impact of the AI ​​wave, no matter whether it is science and engineering, liberal arts, or art, whether it is grassroots production personnel, professional and technical personnel, administrative personnel, or even senior executives, all People can stay out of things. Where will the development of science and technology push mankind in the future? This may have exceeded our current cognitive abilities and thinking framework.

;

;

;;

;

;Liu Youbin, spokesperson of the Ministry of Ecology and Environment. Ministry of Ecology and Environment | Picture

;

;On October 27, 2023, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment held a regular press conference. Liu Youbin, spokesperson of the Ministry of Ecology and Environment, said that the theme of this conference is to actively respond to climate change, promote green, low-carbon and high-quality development, and release the "2023 Annual Report on China's Policies and Actions to Address Climate Change".

;

;Since the launch of the national carbon market in July 2021, the quality of carbon emission data has attracted much attention. Xia Yingxian, director of the Department of Climate Change, made his debut after taking up his new post. When answering questions from Southern Weekend reporters, he said that overall, companies' awareness of emission reduction has significantly improved, their regulatory capabilities have been significantly improved, and the quality of carbon emission data has been significantly improved.

;

;Among the measures taken by the Ministry of Ecology and Environment, the "national-provincial-municipal" three-level joint review mechanism for carbon emission data quality plays an important role. After enterprises submit data and certification materials through the management platform every month, national departments are responsible for big data screening and regular spot checks, provincial government departments are responsible for technical review, and prefecture-level government departments are responsible for on-site spot checks.

;

;Xia Yingxian introduced that the "national-provincial-municipal" three-level joint review mechanism follows the management idea of ​​"using the day to protect the month, using the month to protect the year" to ensure that every day , monthly, and annual data are stable and reliable, "reflecting our cautious and cautious attitude towards data quality."

;

;;

;

;Xia Yingxian, Director of the Department of Climate Change Response of the Ministry of Ecology and Environment. Ministry of Ecology and Environment | Picture

;

;Do a good job in daily supervision of data quality

;

;Xia Yingxian said that the Ministry of Ecology and Environment has always attached great importance to carbon emission data quality management. There is "zero tolerance" for illegal and illegal activities such as data falsification. Especially since 2022, a series of measures have been taken to ensure that carbon emission data is accurate and reliable, focusing on comprehensively improving data quality.

;

;For example, in terms of the construction of the legal system, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment has actively cooperated with the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuratorate to revise and issue judicial interpretations to criminalize the falsification of carbon emission data. Sanction scope. The accounting and verification guidelines were revised and introduced, reducing the formulas involved in carbon emission report verification from 27 to 12, optimizing the accounting methods, and effectively improving the pertinence, scientificity and operability of the work.

;

;In terms of supervision and law enforcement, since 2021, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment has organized supervision and assistance, guided by problem clues, guided enterprises to standardize emission accounting reporting behaviors, and severely cracked down on Engage in deceptive behavior. Xia Yingxian said that the Ministry of Ecology and Environment will severely punish and reduce carbon emission quotas for emission-controlled companies that have verified data to be falsified in accordance with the law; it has exposed a number of third-party verification agencies that violate laws and regulations, which has a great deterrent effect.

;

;In terms of carbon emission management capabilities, Xia Yingxian introduced that the national carbon emissions trading management platform will be launched online in 2023, realizing inventory management, emission management, and data quality supervision. , verification management, and quota management are intelligent and digital, and big data means are used to enrich data quality management technical means. Since 2023, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment has held 5 special training courses on carbon emission data quality management and supervision and law enforcement, with more than 5,000 trainees, and supervision capabilities have been significantly improved.

;

;Xia Yingxian also said that in the next step, we will continue to do a good job in daily supervision of data quality and make full use of the "national-provincial-municipal" three-level joint review working mechanism. Conduct spot checks and reports on data quality management work in various regions, establish and improve daily supervision and technical review systems for greenhouse gas emission data, clarify technical review standards and procedures, and consolidate the main responsibilities of key emission units.

;

;;Carbon price is in line with China’s current reality;

;

;At the press conference , Xia Yingxian also mentioned the progress of the national carbon market construction.

;

;A total of 2,257 key emission units in the power generation industry have been included in the second compliance cycle (2021 and 2022) of the national carbon market, covering annual carbon dioxide emissions of more than 5 billion tons. . The quotas for 2021 and 2022 have been distributed in August 2023, and payment and compliance are currently underway. Xia Yingxian revealed that the current contract fulfillment rate has exceeded 60%.

;

;Xia Yingxian believes that the national carbon market has achieved the expected construction goals. ;Xia Yingxian said that the national carbon market has initially established an institutional framework system, breaking through the blocking points in key links such as reporting verification, quota allocation, market transactions, settlement and compliance, etc. Difficulties, and realize full-service intelligence through the national carbon market management platform.

;

;Regarding the topic of carbon market expansion, Xia Yingxian stated that it is urgent to include more qualified industries into the national carbon emissions trading market to reduce the cost of emission reduction for the whole society. We will insist on making progress while maintaining stability, and prioritize the inclusion of industries that contribute significantly to achieving the goal of carbon peak and carbon neutrality, have serious overcapacity, have great synergy potential for pollution reduction and carbon reduction, and have good data quality foundations. Each mature industry will be included in the industry.

;

;The expansion of the carbon market requires a good data foundation. Xia Yingxian introduced that the Ministry of Ecology and Environment conducts annual carbon emission accounting report verification work nationwide every year for petrochemical, chemical, building materials, steel, non-ferrous metals, papermaking, civil aviation and other industries, and collects data from more than 6,000 companies. The above-mentioned 7 industries The total direct emissions from the power generation and power generation industries account for more than 70% of the country's total. In addition, special studies were organized on quota allocation methods, accounting and reporting methods, verification points, and expansion implementation paths for seven industries.

;

;As of October 25, 2023, the cumulative transaction volume of carbon emission quotas is 365 million tons, and the cumulative transaction volume is 19.437 billion yuan. The carbon price after the launch of the national carbon market Maintained at around 50-80 yuan/ton.

;

;"Recently, the quota price has shown an overall upward trend, maintaining at around 80 yuan/ton. The moderate increase in carbon price reflects the market nature of carbon price." In the next step, we will study the establishment of a market adjustment mechanism and take measures such as early warning of contract performance risks to adjust market supply and demand, enhance market vitality, and ensure the healthy, stable and orderly operation of the market.

; Sun, 29 Oct 2023 08:25:03 +0800 从“三吠举报”到“恶犬法案”：美国人怎么养狗？http://www.infzm.com/contents/259368
;;2023-10-28 23:00:00;
;

;It is well known that many people in the United States love dogs. However, these Americans love and raise dogs to achieve a certain balance under the support of their specific natural conditions, social conditions and legal environment.

;

;First of all, in my opinion, the most important and overlooked point is that the United States is not a rabies epidemic area.

;

;A total of 202 human rabies cases were reported in 143 districts and counties in China in 2020. Dogs in the United States hardly carry the rabies virus, and the few rabies cases are caused by wild animals (mainly bats). A total of five people died of rabies in the United States in 2021, the highest number of rabies deaths in the country in 10 years.

;

;Differences in natural conditions will cause huge differences in social adaptation. When there are no worries about rabies, the intimacy between humans and cats and dogs will greatly increase, and dogs will not be too taboo about what they eat or lick. Even strange stray dogs don’t have to worry about rabies. This creates a close human-dog relationship.

;

;The second is the living area and living pattern of Americans.

;

;In 2021, the per capita housing area in the United States is 67 square meters, ranking first in the world. In addition to the large average area, there are also structural differences in urbanization rates. The overall average urbanization rate in the United States currently reaches 83%, and the urbanization rate in some metropolitan areas is close to 100%. China's urbanization rate in 2022 will be 65.22%. The problem of dog ownership is largely an urban problem.

;

;Calculated in terms of per capita housing area in domestic cities, especially large and medium-sized cities, it is about half that of the United States. This is just the living area, not the living mode. Chinese people mostly live in high-rise buildings and share the green environment of the community, while Americans mostly live in suburban villas. Americans have far more outdoor space per household. Therefore, Chinese people use half of their living area and much less public outdoor area to raise dogs, which naturally creates more conflicts.

;

;The United States also has another characteristic, that is, it is more diverse, has a large place, has many choices, and does not interfere with each other. It not only protects the rights of dog lovers, but also protects the rights of people who do not love dogs. There are many communities in the United States that prohibit pets. Not only are dogs not allowed in these communities, but dogs from outside are not even allowed to "visit". Have a peaceful time together.

;

;Although Americans love dogs, and although the living area is large, the density is low, and there are many green spaces, it does not mean that American dogs do not bite people.

;

;According to the U.S. National Library of Medicine, approximately 1,000 people in the United States require emergency care treatment for serious dog bites every day, and more than 4.5 million people are bitten by dogs each year, with 30 to 50 People are killed by dogs. Injuries caused by dog ​​bites and attacks result in the need for 30,000 surgeries in the United States each year, including sutures and staples. In 2020, U.S. insurance companies paid $854 million for dog bites and attacks, with the average dog bite insurance claim amount being $50,245.

;

;The Humane Society of the United States estimates that 51% of dog bite victims are children, which means more than 2 million children are bitten by dogs in the United States each year. Among dog bite deaths, the highest proportion is among those aged 0-4 years. Since children under 1 year old are often unable to walk and are often looked after by adults, the rate of bites is the lowest. After the age of 4, as children get older, the likelihood of being bitten decreases.

;

;So, although Americans love dogs, they also strictly manage dog ownership.

;

;For general harassment, take New York City as an example. If you are reported for not picking up dog poop while walking your dog, the police will issue a $250 (1,800 RMB) fine and may also require you to appear in court. The law also prohibits the harassment of pet dogs in all public and private places. If the dog is not kept on a leash, a fine of 200-400 US dollars will be imposed. For dog nuisances, follow the "three barking report" principle: if a dog from any household barks more than three times in a residential area, it will be considered a nuisance, and neighbors can report it. Under strict regulations, most dog walkers in the United States are self-conscious, and leash-free dog walking is rare. If a dog poops, most dog owners use plastic bags to collect the poop.

;

;In addition, the law stipulates that people who keep high-risk ferocious dogs must erect signs in conspicuous places in their yards to remind passersby to pay attention. In public places, high-risk ferocious dogs must wear a restraint leash and an anti-bite muzzle at all times. Otherwise, law enforcement agencies have the right to impound or execute the dog. Depending on the severity of the case, the dog owner may be held criminally responsible and may even be sentenced to 90 days in jail.

;

;For higher levels of physical risk, some states have enacted so-called "vicious dog laws." A dog is considered a "vicious dog" if it attacks or injures a human or their pet within a two-year period, or exhibits aggressive behavior that requires the police or animal control agencies to stop or drive away. Such dogs must be isolated, prohibited from contact with humans, and undergo mandatory training. If the owner refuses to cooperate, the dog may be euthanized. The Vicious Dog Act requires dog owners to take full responsibility for their dogs. If a dog attacks a person and the owner fails to take strict precautions and deal with it promptly, resulting in casualties, the dog owner must be responsible for all injuries and may even be subject to criminal penalties. If a dog attacks a human after escaping, the owner is still responsible for the dog's behavior.

;

;There are very sound pet shelters and rescue stations across the United States, funded by the government and private organizations, to take in and rescue stray cats and dogs. In shelters, sheltered dogs and other animals are treated well. Americans love dogs, and there are always enough volunteers at shelters. Stray dogs in shelters generally have a 1-2 week deadline for adoption. Non-governmental animal protection organizations also try their best to allow dogs in shelters to be adopted. After that, if no one comes to adopt them, they will be euthanized. Statistics show that of the 8.5 million stray dogs sheltered in the United States in 2010, 82% were adopted and taken away by new owners, while the remaining 1.53 million old, sick, and unadopted dogs were euthanized. Although many civil organizations are trying to change euthanasia and replace it with sterilization, raising funds is still an unavoidable obstacle.

;

;All public issues are like this. Rights and obligations cannot be neglected or mentioned only on one side.

;

; Sat, 28 Oct 2023 23:25:03 +0800 年度佳作，没有人经得起剖析审视http://www.infzm.com/contents/259240

;

;;There are many movies about marriage. You can easily pull up a long movie list. ;

;

;;But this topic is never out of date, and has different interpretations in the eyes of different people. ;

;

;;No, this year Cannes presents us with another blockbuster work - "Anatomy of a Death from a Fall"

;

;;;

;Director Justine Trier is a female director. Her first two works were "Victoria" and "Sibyl", both of which were self-written and directed, focusing on female expression. At the same time, Justine Trier is also the third female director in the history of Cannes to win the Palme d'Or for this film. ;

;

;;

;

;;The starring role is German actress Sandra Wheeler. In 2006;, at the age of 28, she won the Berlin Film Festival for her performance in "Requiem" Film Festival Silver Bear Award for Best Actress. ;

;

;;

;

;The talented female director teamed up with powerful actresses to present this masterpiece that cannot be missed this year.

;

;;;01;;

;

;The heroine Sandra is a well-known writer with strong creative power and very high productivity. Coupled with her androgynous temperament, she has accumulated many readers.

;

;On this day, while Sandra was being interviewed by a young female student majoring in literature, loud music suddenly came from upstairs.

;

;This reckless and rude interruption announced the existence of another person: Sandra's husband Samuel.

;

;;;

;;Samuel was originally a university professor and also wanted to write. However, unlike his wife, who was full of literary ideas, he seemed to always get stuck halfway and find it difficult to write. ;

;

;;The two have an 11-year-old son named Daniel, who is visually impaired. ;

;

;;However, this disability is not congenital, but is caused to some extent by Samuel: One day a few years ago, Samuel was supposed to pick up Daniel from school. But he suddenly got inspiration for writing and hired someone to pick up his son. During this period, Daniel had a car accident and damaged his eyes. ;

;

;;

;

;;The accident not only interrupted their careers, but also put this middle-class family into financial difficulties due to medical expenses. ;

;

;;In order to reduce debt pressure, Samuel suggested moving his family from London, England to his hometown in the suburbs of France. For Sandra, she lost her stable life in London and entered an unfamiliar environment. ;

;

;;

;

;;Sandra has no one here, and her interview with the female student can only end hastily after being interrupted by Samuel. Soon, Daniel, who was returning from walking his dog, found his father's bloody body in the snow. He shouted for his mother, and Sandra, who came in a hurry, quickly called the police. ;

;

;;

;

;;After identification, the fatal injury to the deceased Samuel was a heavy blow to the head. Although it appears that he fell to his death, he was most likely murdered. ;

;

;;

;

;;But their family’s residence was nowhere to be found, and there were no other outsiders present when the incident occurred. Samuel usually had no enemies. ;

;

;;Thus, the common conclusion in crime movies; is readily apparent: the murderer is the wife Sandra, and she must be resentful of her husband. Is this really the case?

;

;;;02;;

;

;;Sandra was controlled as the first suspect, and Daniel was on the scene The only witness. To prove her innocence, Sandra must convince the judge that there is love but not hatred between her and her husband, and that she has no motive for killing. At this point,;;a death case has become a trial of a marriage. ;

;

;;"Anatomy of Death from Falling from a Building" also enters into the detailed ;;analysis of marriage relationships: When a person ;; dies In this case, how can the other party prove itself? ;

;

;;

;

;;At this time, except for Sandra, everyone else was basically in the same blind; situation as Daniel. After all, except for the two parties involved, everyone is an outsider in this relationship. ;

;

;;

;

;;So neither the psychiatrist’s testimony, which was heavily psychoanalytic, nor the defense provided by lawyers on both sides, could touch the real Samuel. ;

;

;;There is no way to reach the core of a living person or a love through words. But this trial has to find the truth through language. This is the contradiction. ;

;

;;

;

;;Because she was in France, Sandra had to use her unskilled language to defend herself. Love; is not like this: stumbling communication, but in the end it is inaccurate words.

;

;;;

;;Words always have a certain performance quality, and "Anatomy of Death from a Fall" also presents this through a perfect recording. The film also completely enters the climax after the opening 80 minutes. . Samuel carried Sandra on his back and recorded the heated argument that broke out between the two on the day before her death. ;

;

;;In the recording, Samuel accused Sandra of only caring about her career and ignoring her family, saying that she was always aloof, saying that she clearly blamed herself for causing Daniel's tragedy but refused to admit it. She plagiarized her own ideas and cheated on her physically...;

;

;;

;

;;Sandra was not to be outdone. From the beginning, she calmly advised Samuel not to complain and not to be self-motivated, but later she became unbearable. Gave him a slap...;

;

;;

;

;;Such a quarrel must have been experienced by most couples and couples who have passed the passionate love stage. It is difficult for outsiders to say that the public is justified and the mother-in-law is justified. Determine right or wrong. ;

;

;;But the problem is that this quarrel and physical conflict happened the day before Samuel's death, which undoubtedly pushed Sandra towards the angry wife who murdered her husband. image. ;;The troubled media are still chewing on Sandra’s book at this time, believing that her murder of her husband was premeditated. But is this really the case?

;

;;;

;;;03;;

;

;;"Anatomy of Death from a Fall" is a work that analyzes marriage as delicately as a scalpel. ;

;

;;As a middle-aged female director, Justine Trier has not only gotten rid of the male perspective, but also has passed the stage of young women's blind longing for marriage. ;

;

;;On the one hand, she is very creative in placing the marriage relationship in the court scene to analyze, on the other hand, she still has the unique tenderness and pioneering spirit of women. ;

;

;;For example, in the setting of the heroine Sandra, she has a strong androgynous temperament, which is different from common female images. ;

;

;;

;

;At the same time, compared to common settings, the situations and personalities of Sandra and Samuel are also reversed: Sandra has a successful career, a peaceful personality, and is close to her children; while Samuel Not only did I encounter a career development bottleneck, but I also became more emotional and exhausted my creativity. ;

;

;;This image and gender setting itself break through the stereotype of male narrative. ;

;

;;In addition, the film uses calm and restrained lens language and narrative expression, trying to go deeper into the truth of the death case and give the audience a sense of clarity beyond the case itself. ;

;

;;There are two recordings in the movie, one is the interview of the female student that day, and the other is the quarrel privately recorded by Samuel. These two daily conversations were analyzed and interpreted word for word in public in court, and were even used as evidence of crimes. ;

;

;;When the second quarrel started by Samuel appears in court, the gender balance begins to tilt, and Sandra needs to explain all of Samuel's dilemmas : Why does he have to choose between work and family? Why does he never have time to write novels? Why is his creativity exhausted while she publishes novels frequently? Why is he frigid and she cheats on her physically? ;

;

;;At this time, the intimate relationship must be put on the table to experience the scrutiny of others, and then others will give the final conclusion. Sandra was extremely embarrassed. What she encountered was not only a discussion about gender, but also a trial of marriage. ;

;

;;At the age of only 11, their son Daniel has already experienced major events such as car accidents, disability, the death of his father and defending his mother. He is actually the avatar of the audience. After listening to the trial half-blindly, he finally chose his mother. ;

;

;;

;

;;But this choice itself, even Sandra's innocence itself, cannot achieve complete emotional catharsis, because when feelings need to be judged, it means that there will be no survivors. ;

;

;;The film's use of telephoto lenses, soft light, and close-up lenses makes the images presented in the film more cold and distant. ;

;

;;

;

;;In addition to the exquisite narrative of "Anatomy of Death from a Fall", the most commendable thing is the performance of the heroine. ;

;

;;On the one hand, she is a talented and famous writer, and on the other hand, she is a wife and mother who is troubled by intimate relationships. The emotions and gestures she expresses directly support her. Played the role itself. ;

;

;;

;

;;In the movie, Sandra is well aware of the complexity of language. She refutes others' attempts to define Samuel again and again, and always uses negative statements to retain Samuel. beautiful image. ;

;

;;"That's not him.";

;

;;This denial itself is an expression of private love, but love cannot be declared to Mouth proves that love is so absurd. ;

;

;;So in the court that tried to convict her, she was the only one who loved the real Samuel. She did not kill him, but she did kill him. ;

;;

;

;Lodro Wolong Temple is built along the cliff, and the huts on the cliff are used for monks' practice. The cave ;(Zhang Wei/Photo);

;

;Tawny and bare, this was my first impression of Luoza County. Luozha County is located in a mountain valley, and the county seat winds along the only mountain road in the middle. I chose to come to Luozha, Shannan City, to visit the Sakagutuo Temple with a history of more than 900 years in the Border Se Township. This is a pilgrimage road often walked by Buddhists. It has a long history and a mysterious place. As for the scenery, although I am not a Buddhist, I am also full of yearning for the beautiful scenery on the border.

;

;At 9 o'clock in the morning, I set off from the bus station in the northern suburbs of Lhasa and passed through the beautiful Yanghu Lake and rows of snow-capped mountains. When I arrived in Lozha County, it was about 4 o'clock in the afternoon. I immediately bought the only daily ticket at the station. A ticket to Sexiang. It still takes nearly two hours to drive to Sexiang. The road begins to narrow and there are more gravels. But I was still attracted by the barren and spectacular scenery outside the window. One side of the car is close to the exposed rocks, and the other side is close to the rushing river. The river is rushing forward happily, as if it is racing with the car.

;

;;

;

;Loza County;(Zhang Wei/Picture);

;

;There were only five or six people on the bus An old Tibetan man, a young Tibetan man and me. The young Tibetan man comes from the Garze region and has been traveling to Tibet for more than half a year. This time he went specifically to Lapu Hot Spring in Sexiang. He wore a down jacket and carried a small plastic bag with him, but no other luggage.

;

;It was already 7:30 when I arrived in Sexiang. I quickly found a place to stay before it got dark. The entire township is located on a flat land in the mountains. There are dozens of buildings built along the road. They are all occupied by local people. In order to welcome guests, some have been converted into hotels and some into restaurants. Hotels are either closed or full, and the owner is rarely there, leaving only a phone number. Finally, I finally found a bed at the Sakaguto Temple Hotel. There was a public bathroom, but I couldn't take a shower.

;

;;

;

;Saika Gutuo Temple in Sexiang;(Zhang Wei/Picture);

;

;sai Kagutuo Monastery was originally a monastery of the Kagyu sect of Tibetan Buddhism, but later converted to the Gelug sect. It is a must-visit place for Tibetan pilgrims. The main building of Sakagutuo Temple, which has a history of more than 900 years, has been relatively completely preserved. The temple is located in the middle of Se Township, next to the cliff, and the sound of rushing river water comes from the bottom of the mountain, which is quiet and distant.

;

;There is a legendary and touching story of redemption behind the nine-story tower of Sakagutuo Temple. According to legend, in the 11th century, Marpa, the founder of the Kagyu sect, who was known as "one of the seven great translators of ancient Tibet", had a disciple named Milarepa. He lost his father when he was young, his wealth was seized by relatives, and his family was enslaved. When he grew up, he learned magic and killed 35 people in revenge. Later, in order to atone for his sins, Milarepa came to Sexiang to become a disciple of Marpa. Marpa ordered Milarepa to build Sakagutuo Temple alone (;Means "Nine-story Gongzi Castle";). Day after day, year after year, every time he built it, Marpa asked him to overthrow and rebuild it, until it was finally completed the sixth time. The current Sakagutuo Temple was built at that time (;later repaired and expanded;). Ancient prayer wheels hang on the outside of the predominantly yellow temple, and murals from hundreds of years ago can still be faintly seen on the mottled walls inside.

;

;;

;

;Green space by the Sexiang River and a released calf;(Zhang Wei/picture);

;

;There is a small suspended plank road on the top of the 9-story watchtower tower for people to pray for blessings. When I climbed to the ninth floor, a lama said that since I had come up, I should go around the tower. It is said that turning once can wash away all the bad luck in the past life; turning twice can pray for the health and happiness of parents; turning three times will prevent you from falling into hell in the next life. However, except for the steel poles that can be grasped by hand, there are no protective fences around the top of the tower. I was afraid of heights and dared not go up. Finally, I walked around in a circle under the leadership of the lama. The young lama chanted sutras while walking. He walked many times every day and it became a daily routine.

;

;The Sakagutuo Temple is very small and can be completed in less than half an hour. On the top of the mountain south of Sexiang, there is also Lodro Wolong Monastery, which is the birthplace of the Kagyu Sect of Tibetan Buddhism and was built by Master Marpa when he was 29 years old. According to the official website of Luozha County Government, "Luo" means "south", "Zhuowo" means "beginning of auspiciousness", and "Long" means "prophecy". Luozhawolong Temple is where the master predicted and prophesied. place.

;

;It takes several hours to walk to the Luozhuo Wolong Temple on the top of the mountain, and there is no public transportation. I found a ride on the road and met a Tibetan family who drove up the mountain and picked me up. The family came from neighboring Cona County and came to Luozha County for pilgrimage for the first time.

;

;;

;

;

;For Furong District, the extra 120 meters of road construction is within my jurisdiction. According to regulations, road construction should follow procedures and be submitted for approval in advance. It is of course illegal to build roads without approval. The competent department requires that the illegal status be eliminated and the construction be restored to its original state. The construction application procedures will be completed before re-repairing, which is completely "in accordance with the law and regulations and in compliance with the procedures."

;

;There seems to be nothing wrong with both sides. However, after construction and demolition, demolition and construction again, a lot of money was wasted. What went wrong?

;

;The Jingkai District Urban Construction Company that built the road built it without approval. Of course, there were violations of laws and regulations. However, the road has been repaired, and it is indeed a road that has been long-awaited by the nearby people and is necessary to be repaired. However, if it is forced to be demolished, the problem may be even greater.

;

;First of all this is a huge waste of public funds. Although the 120-meter road is not long, it costs a lot. The entire road is about 1 kilometer long and costs 60 million yuan. Calculating the cost of 120 meters is 6 to 7 million yuan, and dismantling it will also cost a lot of money. Once it was built or demolished, millions would disappear. This is a municipal road, and the Economic Development Zone Urban Construction Company responsible for its construction is also a state-owned enterprise. The source of its construction funds must be public funds of the local government, that is, public money. For Furong District, it is a good thing that the Economic Development Zone is willing to spend the money to build its own roads. If it is forced to be demolished and then rebuilt by oneself, although the cost of demolition will be borne by the Economic Development District Urban Construction Company, the cost of reconstruction will still be borne by Furong District. It is also incomprehensible to abandon existing roads that have been built with help from others and to dig up and spend money to rebuild them yourself.

;

;Secondly, a section of the repaired road is dug out, and the rest becomes a dead end road. It took three years to build this road, and the nearby people had been waiting for it for three years. It was finally opened, but a section was demolished, and its effectiveness was greatly reduced. If we have to go through the formalities and rebuild it again, I am afraid we will have to wait at least another year and a half. This will bring great inconvenience to the public's travel and will also damage the image of the local government in the public mind.

;

;Requiring the Economic Development Zone to demolish the roads and then rebuild them themselves can be said to be harmful to Furong District and not beneficial to itself. So why do the relevant departments in Furong District do this? From the perspective of organizational behavior, perhaps one or two explanations can be given. For some departments, they must make the decision on their own territory. It is absolutely unacceptable for others to interfere with their boundaries without telling them. Even if you spend more money, you must maintain your authority. After all, if you want to spend money, it is also a financial expense, rather than having to pay out of your own pocket. Only consider issues from the perspective of one place and one department, from the perspective of maintaining the authority of the local area and this department, only consider legal compliance from the perspective of this department, and show your sense of existence.

;

;As for whether the decision made is reasonable from a higher level, whether it will waste financial resources and state-owned assets, waste local taxpayers' money and public interests and perceptions, and consume administrative credibility, it is not considered. scope.

;

;This incident shows the fragmentation and lack of coordination among relevant government departments, the lack of appreciation for the use of fiscal funds, and the lack of care for the waste of state-owned assets. Such things are not uncommon. In the past few years, roads in some cities have been dug up frequently. Today they are laying water pipes, tomorrow they are burying wires, and the day after tomorrow they have to repair sewers. Frequently digging and repairing, repairing and digging again not only wastes construction funds, but also doubles the construction period and brings great inconvenience to citizens' travel.

;

;Fortunately, after the media reports this time, the relevant departments of Changsha Furong District have urgently stopped the behavior of damaging the road surface, and have speeded up the relevant procedures to legalize the 120-meter road as soon as possible. This case has been solved. I hope there will be fewer such absurd things in the future.

; Sat, 28 Oct 2023 20:25:04 +0800 “软实力之父”约瑟夫·奈：“中美间的交流应该是面向所有人的”http://www.infzm.com/contents/259507

;"Is there destined to be a war between China and the United States? My answer Yes, no." Joseph Nye, a professor at Harvard Kennedy School, gave a negative answer.

;

;Joseph Nye is a representative figure of the neoliberal school of international relations. Before and after the Cold War, Joseph Nye was famous for proposing the concept of "soft power". Soft power refers to a country's strength other than economic and military strength, and mainly refers to influence such as culture, values, and public opinion.

;

;He served successively as Assistant Secretary of State in the Carter administration, Chairman of the National Intelligence Council and Assistant Secretary of Defense in the Clinton administration. He is also a leading figure in American politics. But he reminded that the history of mankind is full of situations where wars "accidentally" entered. As long as China and the United States strengthen cooperation and act cautiously, wars can be avoided.

;

;China-US relations are one of the most important bilateral relations in the world today. On October 27, 2023, U.S. President Biden met at the White House with visiting member of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of China Central Committee and Foreign Minister Wang Yi.

;

;Since October 23, Joseph Nye has embarked on his first visit to China after the COVID-19 epidemic. Judging from the public schedule in just one week, the "Father of Soft Power" has successively attended speeches at many think tanks and universities.

;

;On the afternoon of October 25, in the Qiulin Lecture Hall of the School of International Relations at Peking University, Joseph Nye spoke with the topic "Are China and the United States destined to have a war?" Hundreds of teachers and students discussed "The History and Future of Sino-US Relations." The conference was jointly hosted by the School of International Relations at Peking University and the Institute of International Strategic Studies at Peking University.

;

;Joseph Nye once proposed the "20-year cycle theory of Sino-US relations", that is, since the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and the United States, the ups and downs of the relationship between the two countries have been based on a 20-year cycle. And change.

;

;"In the long run, China and the United States will have better relations. But in the short term, China and the United States still have differences to resolve." Joseph Nye told the South Weekend reporter.

;

;Joseph Nye believes that after 2017, Sino-US relations entered a cycle of great power competition. "China-U.S. relations have gotten worse in the past. In a sense, I think we have seen the deterioration of Sino-U.S. relations, but I hope things will get better." Joseph Nye told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In recent years, discussions about the "new cold war" between China and the United States have been rampant in European and American public opinion circles.

;

;In Joseph Nye's view, the Cold War between China and the United States is completely incommensurable with the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union. “During the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union, although there was military and political competition between the two countries, their economic and social ties were very sparse. But now China and the United States are highly interdependent in many fields such as economy, society, and ecology. ”

;

;In 2020, Joseph Nye wrote an article in the "Wall Street Journal" that the Cold War between China and the United States is completely avoidable.

;

;Joseph Nye supports China and the United States in strengthening cooperation in public health, climate change and other fields.

;

;"Exchanges between China and the United States should be open to everyone. Exchanges at the cultural and scientific levels are equally important." Joseph Nye told Southern Weekend reporters that he hopes The public's attention should not only focus on high-level people, but also exert soft power. Low-level contacts are also very important.

;

;;The following is an interview with Joseph Nye:;

;

; Sino-US relations have gotten worse in the past. In a sense, we have seen a deterioration in Sino-US relations, but I hope things will get better.

;

;Unfortunately, during the COVID-19 epidemic, communication between China and the United States has not been sufficient. However, communication between China and the United States has begun to change. The United States sent important cabinet members to visit China, and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi also arrived in Washington for a visit.

;

;I think Sino-US relations are making progress. Two years ago, Sino-US relations were worse than they are now. What we're seeing today is some pickup, and I hope it continues.

;

;Among China and the United States, China not only has strong economic performance, but also has the attraction of traditional culture. I believe that a country’s soft power comes not only from government actions but also from civil society.

;

;The U.S. government often does some unpopular things, but despite this, America's civil society remains attractive to others because it is relatively free. Therefore, the soft power of the United States comes more from universities, non-profit organizations, and foundations, such as the Bill Gates Foundation.

;

;It is undeniable that people's views of the United States have gone up and down in recent years. In my opinion, the soft power of the United States has gone up and down. During the Vietnam War and when U.S. troops invaded Iraq, U.S. soft power was declining. The soft power of the United States returned again with the election of Obama as President of the United States in 2008, and fell together with Trump (who became President of the United States) in 2016.

;

;Soft power does not decline linearly or rise linearly. It is often cyclical.

;

;Now, the soft power of the United States is weakening due to internal divisions within the United States. On the other hand, if you look at the hard power of the United States, you will see that the U.S. economy is booming. The United States is a wellspring of innovation, leading in technological fields such as biotechnology and artificial intelligence. Looking at the situation in the Middle East today, (U.S.) military power is still very important.

;

;The Biden administration has been in power for three years and has a more balanced view (compared to the Trump administration). They still believe there are still benefits to working with China.

;

;In May this year, the G7 summit changed its focus on decoupling from China to de-risking on China. This expression means Countries outside the G7 will adopt partial decoupling from China, mostly in the security field.

;

;In other words, de-risking does not mean completely cutting off economic ties, but there are limits. U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan called it "building a high wall around a small yard." We should not let this small yard grow.

;

;To prevent deterioration, Sino-US relations should start with high-level contacts. Next, look for areas of cooperation between China and the United States, which can convey to the public of both countries that cooperation with another country is beneficial.

;

;I think this is an area where China and the United States can strengthen cooperation (position on the Russia-Ukraine conflict).

;

;China and the United States can also strengthen cooperation in other areas, such as climate change and working with the WHO to respond to epidemics.

;

;Exchanges between China and the United States should be open to everyone. Obviously, people always focus on the president or the cabinet. Exchange on cultural and scientific levels is equally important. If we need to build trust and cooperation (with each other) and exert soft power, low-level engagement is very important.

;

;(Sino-US relations) have become increasingly complex and difficult to resolve in the short term. I tend to use "short-term pessimists" and "long-term optimists" to describe China and the United States as not posing a threat to each other. In the long run, China and the United States will have better relations. But in the short term, China and the United States still have differences to resolve.
