;

;July 2021, Chongqing Mountain City Trail, sculptures representing Chongqing sticks and traditional stilted buildings. (Visual China/Picture)

;

;"How can a girl become a stickman? How can she afford the work? Go and do something lighter. You're still alive." This is the advice that 51-year-old Huang Xiuli often encounters when carrying goods at Chongqing's Chaotianmen Comprehensive Wholesale Market.

;

;Standing on the heights of Chaotianmen, you can see the intersection of the Jialing River and the Yangtze River. This is the largest water pier in Chongqing. South of the Jialing River and on the north bank of the Yangtze River is the Yangtze River Binjiang Road. On this modern street, there is the Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market, the largest wholesale market gathering place in Chongqing. It is like a streamer, flowing with people buying goods from all over the country. Chongqing’s economy.

;

;The mountainous city of Chongqing has steep roads and few flat areas, and its unique topography provides Bangbang with a living space. "Bangbang" is a Chongqing dialect that originally means "stick". It is a local name for farmers who carry a bamboo stick and engage in heavy manual labor. In the Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market, Bangbangs are responsible for the last link in this economic chain: transportation.

;

;If you look carefully, you can find a few female figures among the sticks passing through the shops in the market. With their hair cut short or in buns, they look sophisticated and sophisticated, just like the men who dominate the industry.

;

;Some of them work alone, and some open "couple teams". In industries where they sell their physical strength to make a living, they often have to deal with employers questioning their "business capabilities." But even so, they don't want to give up the stick.

;

;“Moving things uphill is the most annoying thing”

;

;At Chaotianmen at 6 o'clock in the morning, the freighter on the riverside sounded its whistle, and the truck and asphalt The sound of the road rubbing against each other was more lively than the Chongqing night market.

;

;On September 30, 2023, Huang Xiuli opened the window, and the noise and sunlight penetrated into the room. On the floor were corrugated boxes of pickles and corrugated boxes that Huang Xiuli had collected from various places. Drink bottles and leftovers were scattered on the table... Huang Xiuli picked out this house filled with musty smell one pound at a time. of.

;

;Huang Xiuli has been a "professional player" for 24 years. A stick, a three-meter-long red nylon rope, and a 232 yuan trolley are all her assistants in her work. Every morning at 6:45, Huang Xiuli goes to work in Dazheng Shopping Mall on time. While waiting for orders to come to her door, she and other Bang Bangs set up a gantry formation.

;

;;

;

;In September 2023, Huang Xiuli was transporting goods. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;The employer that Huang Xiuli works with the most is Liu Chunsheng, nicknamed "Liu Youtou". He has been selling men's clothing in Dazheng Shopping Mall for 25 years , with a bulging beer belly and a conspicuous bald head. Every morning when Liu Youtou was sorting out the cargo list, Huang Xiuli came over to help him load and carry the goods bag by bag according to the delivery location.

;

;Liu Youtou agreed to pay 30 yuan per bag, which was the better price Huang Xiuli could get at Chaotianmen Market. One bag weighs 309.6 kilograms, and the straight-line distance is 324 meters - in 2023, Huang Xiuli's effort is worth an average of 9 cents per kilogram.

;

;"It's affordable, usually more than ten yuan." Most of the goods she carries are clothing, which are light in weight and correspondingly priced lower.

;

;According to Huang Xiuli’s experience, you need to use your brain to carry goods and not be reckless. In order to reduce air resistance, she lowered her head when pulling goods; she wore gloves on her hands to increase friction with the cart. "The most annoying thing is carrying things uphill. Carrying it alone makes my head hurt."

;

;In her early years at Chaotianmen, on the way home, Huang Xiuli’s inventory list Her bag was robbed by a motorcycle. "How can I bear it? It's my hard-earned money." In order to keep the money, Huang Xiuli competed with the motorcycle, causing the bones of her upper arm to shift. "I spent thousands, but the doctor didn't give me any money." Cure”.

;

;Later, for unknown reasons, the soles of Huang Xiuli’s feet swelled up. When she woke up, she started to feel pain when she stepped on the ground early in the morning. She thought about inserting acupuncture and applying medicinal wine on her own, but the more treatment she got, the more "irritated" she became. Therefore, Huang Xiuli likes to roll up half of her trouser legs to "air out" her calves.

;

;Due to physical pain, Huang Xiuli would move sideways slowly when lifting large heavy objects uphill or downhill. For a large box over one meter high, Huang Xiuli will first unfold the rope and move it under the heavy object, lift the two ends, cross-tie them and put them on bamboo sticks, and support the goods with both hands while walking. For Huang Xiuli, the body is not only a tool, but also her partner.

;

;At 4 p.m., every merchant in the Chaotianmen Wholesale Market pulled down their rolling shutters. Huang Xiuli hid her sticks and trucks in the mall and went home to cook.

;

;;

;

;Huang Xiuli cannot use it when going uphill or downhill. Push carts require pure manpower to move goods. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;;Feng Shui Treasure Land;   

;

;Huang Xiuli comes from Dianjiang, 120 kilometers away from the main urban area of ​​Chongqing. She is the youngest in her family and has four sisters. When she was in the countryside, Huang Xiuli often dragged her sister's large clothes to the fields to break buds, harvest wheat, and thresh millet.

;

;Even if she works from dawn to dusk in the village, Huang Xiuli earns only enough money to feed herself. She decided to visit the city. The night before leaving Dianjiang, she went to the bamboo forest in the mountains and cut two bamboos, thinking that she would make money from this stick in the future. That night, Huang Xiuli slept with Bangbang in her arms. The next day, she closed the doors and windows and went straight to the city.

;

;Huang Xiuli came to Chaotianmen in 1997. She was 26 years old that year. She had no crow's feet in her eyes, slightly curly black hair, tied with a black rubber band, and was energetic. Capable. The reason why I came to Chaotianmen is because this is the Feng Shui treasure land for Bangbang people to make a fortune.

;

;In 1991, Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market officially opened. By 1997, the market business area had grown from the initial 6,000 square meters to 270,000 square meters, and the number of operating households had grown from more than 500 to more than 10,000. In 1996, the annual transaction volume of the market here reached 3 billion yuan.

;

;At that time, on Chaodong Road where Bangbang lived, Peng Li, who was in charge of Chongqing Bishan Logistics, opened a freight order of more than 20,000 yuan a day. "My joints hurt so much when I started to write," Peng Li said in pain and happiness. Liu You's first day's trade volume can reach more than 30,000 yuan. He describes his orders as being like a train pulling coal with no end in sight.

;

;Gao Zongqi also caught up with this wave of "dividends". In the late 1990s, Gao Zongqi and Lao Zhao, who were from Qijiang, grew corn in their hometown. In the first year, they took their products to the city to sell them, but half of them were robbed before they even entered the city. They lost money. The next year, I took it to the city to sell it and made another loss. I heard that you can make money by helping people carry things in the city, so the couple picked up the stick and went to Chaotianmen. "I can't read, so it's safer to be with my husband." This has been followed in Chaotianmen for 19 years.

;

;At the end of each year, the couple will receive a package fee of 10,000 yuan from their boss. Zhao laughed and said that he also gets a "year-end bonus" like white-collar workers. They relied on this "year-end bonus" to cover the expenses of returning home for the New Year. Gao Zongqi's parents praised their son-in-law for his promise.

;

;Zhao Dongqiu came to Chaotianmen for his son's wife Ben. Thirty years ago, Zhao Dongqiu and her husband opened a retail store in Anyue County, Sichuan. Although they made more money than farming, the couple was still worried about when they would be able to buy a house for their son and marry him.

;

;After chatting with someone, I learned that being a stick can make money quickly. The couple cut two sections of bamboo in their own mountain, scraped off the bamboo skin with a sickle, and wrapped the bamboo around them. We put on tape and nylon rope, bought tickets overnight, and arrived at Chaotianmen in the early morning.

;

;When he first came to Chaotianmen, Zhao Dongqiu's income was only two yuan a day. But she was not in a hurry and wandered around with the rope (rope) on her back. For four months, Zhao Dongqiu wandered around in Chaotianmen and found out about her own "human society": Which family had a girl who was many years old, and which family had a miserable life. She knew clearly, "We must first get familiar with the circle before others can shout It’s up to you, otherwise I can only work on a blank slate (not earning a penny).”

;

;Slowly, 5 yuan, 10 yuan... more and more consignment notes entered Zhao Dongqiu's pocket. In 2003, the "starting price" of Bangbang was 15 yuan, and Zhao Dongqiu and her husband could get orders of more than 10,000 yuan in a month at most. When carrying goods, Zhao Dongqiu often wears jeans, a yellow shirt worth more than 30 yuan, and a thin gold necklace around his neck.

;

;The cakes in Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trade Market are getting bigger and bigger, and there are more and more sticks. Chongqing University's 2010 "Survey on the Living Conditions of Shancheng Bangbang Army" showed that during the most prosperous period, there were approximately 400,000 Bangbangs in Chongqing, of which 3% were women.

;

;;

;

;Chongqing Chaotianmen Comprehensive Trading Market is a large The first stop for most people looking for work. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;Poet Fu Wei once described it this way: In Chongqing, when your friends are drunk, you can ask a stick to carry them back; for your girlfriend’s birthday, You can ask a group of Bangbangs to send flowers and sing a "Happy Birthday" song; if your pet encounters misfortune, you can ask Bangbangs to help cry...

;

;Although they can make money, Bangbang people live frugally. Ms. Liu and her husband have run the only clinic on Chaodong Road for more than 30 years. In Liu’s impression, it was rare for Bangbang to come to see a doctor. Even if he did come, he would always prescribe some medicine for headaches and fever. “They were reluctant to pay for it. I prescribed a pack of Acafol powder for 10 cents, and he asked me if it could be cheaper. ".

;

;“The boss likes to find male bangbangs”

;

;Female bangbangs are not popular in Chaotianmen.

;

;Gao Zongqi said that Huang Xiuli has a graceful appearance and does not look like a physical worker. There is no market for such a girl in Chaotianmen Bangbang. Once a boss thought she was a girl and couldn't afford the work, so Huang Xiuli would talk back: "I can't afford it without paying!"

;

;"I can afford it." So what if you get up? You will be Bangbang for the rest of your life, and I will be the boss for the rest of your life." The sharp-tongued Huang Xiuli shut up when she heard this. Bangbang, who sells his strength, is inseparable from the boss's choice.

;

;"The boss likes to find men to bang." In this industry, physical strength means money. In the Chaotianmen Wholesale Market, bulk goods shopping malls prefer men with physical strength. "They can earn more than 50 per cart, and I earn 30 per order, which is very little." Hard work can make up for weakness, so Huang Xiuli only has to make a few more trips.

;

;Gao Zongqi was very envious of men who could carry toys. "With a lot of money, he could carry my shoes three times in one trip." She came to Chaotian in 1998. Gate, the new Chongqing Chaotianmen International Shoe Center opposite Huang Xiuli carries goods. Gao Zongqi also discussed it with his boss, but the boss still asked Nan Bangbang next time.

;

;Gao Zongqi was not discouraged and packed his shoes honestly, "Their men are too stupid to do such a delicate job." Every time he learned the amount to be packed, Gao Zongqi began to think about how to put the shoe boxes into the box as much as possible horizontally and vertically. If the stuffing is tight, it will affect the presentation; if the stuffing is wide, the top of the box cannot be sealed with glue, and another box may be wasted.

;

;The steps of Gao Zongqi's packing are like putting on makeup: first apply a base layer horizontally, then change the angle of the second layer to apply it over a large area, and finally apply it like filling acne pits , insert a few small shoe boxes into every slot, and finally seal them with glue and tie them. Gao Zongqi raised his "knife" and cut the packing rope in two.

;

;"Hands are easier to use than knives, but the speed must be fast, otherwise there will be blood." Gao Zongqi, who has been a "bat player" for 25 years, can always find the rope quickly The bifurcation point, quickly pull it off. After years of repeated movements, a groove appeared on the joint of Gao Zongqi's index finger.

;

;After the last step of packaging is completed, Gao Zongqi is also responsible for "after-sales", placing the remaining shoes of the shop owner, picking up the garbage, and then pulling the goods to Opposite the inn.

;

;;

;

;Gao Zongqi packs shoes with her husband. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;Female Bangbang will encounter sexual harassment. When they first came to Chaotianmen, Huang Xiuli and Lao Gao rented a house. On the first day they moved in, Bangbang, a man who lived across the street, saw Huang Xiuli and blurted out: "What a good girl!" and wanted to slap her butt.

;

;"Bah! Even if I'm not married, I won't be friends with you. If you don't know the door, just roll the ball." Huang Xiuli thinks she is a straight person, Don't hide your grievances.

;

;The man was so persistent that at 9 o'clock one night, he asked Huang Xiuli out under the pretext of transporting goods.

;

;"I believe you, who wants to transport goods in the middle of the night? If you try to trick me later, I will trick you first." Huang Xiuli usually has a quiet voice. It's big, but sharp and harsh. If it's a little higher, it can scare a table of men.

;

;;The biggest fear is not being able to deliver the goods;

;

;No matter how difficult it is , Huang Xiuli never thought about quitting Bangbang, but it could not stop the industry from declining.

;

;She remembers clearly that after the Wenchuan earthquake in 2008, the Chaotianmen business was abandoned. “Many people were from Sichuan and Chongqing and went home. Everyone has no intention of making money anymore, their lives are at stake.”

;

;The "aftershocks" were delayed until 2010. Chaotianmen Wholesale Market was facing upgrading and comprehensive renovation, and many merchants had the idea of ​​​​moving out of Chaotianmen. "Outside business has been abandoned, and fewer people are coming to buy goods." Liu Youtou recalled.

;

;With the rise of logistics companies, the competition in the door-to-door express delivery service industry is intensifying. In addition, Chongqing’s rail transit is accessible in all directions and private cars are booming. It seems that everyone is competing for the "Bang Bang" rice bowl". There are fewer and fewer sticks carrying bamboo sticks on their shoulders and wandering the streets asking for work.

;

;In 2021, a survey on the living conditions of Bangbang in Chongqing released by the School of Journalism and Communication of Northwest University for Nationalities estimated that the number of Bangbangs in Chongqing has been less than 2,000, and most of them are elderly. Most people.

;

;;

;

;Gao Zongqi and her husband worked together to carry goods, and met a Pokan, passers-by came together to help. (Zheng Cailin/Picture)

;

;But Gao Zongqi never thought about changing careers. "I don't know anything, I can only contribute." Gao Zongqi is illiterate. She feels that she will be bullied by the maids in the restaurant, and it also depends on the boss's face, which Gao Zongqi doesn't like. She adapted to not having to "punch in" to work. "Bangbang is free and has no one to care about. If you can afford it, take it. If you don't want to do it, rest."

;

;Huang Xiuli doesn't want to go home either. "It's hard to talk to a female Bangbang when she sees someone she knows." Relatives think that Huang Xiuli would be insulted if she worked as a Bangbang in the city. "I don't feel embarrassed, but they always feel like something is wrong with you. How do they know I made a lot of money?"

;

;Huang Xiuli thought, can As long as you make money, the rest doesn't matter. "It doesn't matter whether it's hard or not, the worst thing is that I won't be able to deliver the goods. I'll have to pay hundreds of dollars a day. Every time the money disappears before it's warm in my pocket."

;

;Huang Xiuli did some calculations: the monthly mortgage of 4,000 yuan needs to be paid on time; her son is studying, and the living expenses of 800 yuan a month cannot be less; her daughter has given birth to a grandson, and neither husband nor wife has a job. , Huang Xiuli and Lao Gao provide 2,000 yuan per month. In order to occupy a place in the mall, Huang Xiuli also needs to pay 2,000 yuan "land fee" to the mall every year - occupying a 7-square-meter plot of 15 tiles, where Huang Xiuli's son sits and waits for his mother in his free time. Playing with mobile phones. Including water, electricity, property and food expenses, Huang Xiuli feels that it takes about 8,000 yuan per month to open her home.

;

;September, October, and November every year are the replacement seasons of Chaotianmen Clothing Market. In previous years, it was also the golden period for Bangbang people to make money. But this year, there were no cargo loads after two or three days. According to Lao Zhao, you can’t even pay for water now. Liu Youtou also made up his mind to return to his hometown.

;

;Peng Li is still sitting on the small bench by the roadside, but now she can only issue freight orders of more than 2,000 yuan a day. Huang Xiuli often secretly picks up corrugated cardboard when she gets off work. Gao Zongqi still sits at Chaotianmen International Shoes Co., Ltd. waiting for goods at 6 o'clock every day, and his breakfast has changed from two buds to one. "If you don't have money to earn, don't eat in vain."

;

;There are fewer sticks, and there are even fewer female sticks. Southern Weekend visited and found that there are currently 8 female baseball players in Chaotianmen, 4 of whom are responsible for shoes in the new Chongqing Chaotianmen International Shoe Store, 1 is moving clothes in the third trading area of ​​the shopping mall, and 3 are mobile On Chaodong Road, it mainly transports foreign goods. There are four women in Sanxia Square, two of whom often wait for goods at the entrance of Chongqing New Century Supermarket, and two of whom follow their husbands everywhere to buy goods. There is a female stick worker at the Caiyuanba Bus Station. She closes her stall in the afternoon during the peak season and returns in the morning during the off-season.

;

;When asked where the more female fans went and how many female fans there are in the area now, their answers were all "I don't know." ""not sure". In other Bangbang gathering places such as Guanyinqiao, Baiyakou Street, Shibati, etc., Southern Weekend did not find any female Bangbangs.

;

;Zhao Dongqiu has already saved enough money for her son's daughter-in-law, but she still doesn't want to leave Chaotianmen. Someone once took a fancy to Zhao Dongqiu's cleverness and asked her to settle accounts, but Zhao Dongqiu declined, "It's easier to have fun here, and you can blow everyone off (chat)". Zhao Dongqiu's goal now is to "get off work" after earning 100 yuan a day.

;

;Huang Xiuli still insists on going out every day to find work. Before going out in the morning, she would put homemade medicinal wine on her feet, believing that her home remedies would be more effective than seeing a doctor. "Life is difficult, but I still hope that life will get better."

;

;(Except for Zhao Dongqiu, all names in the article are pseudonyms)
